thread.title: Tony finds love after leaving The Bachelorette mansion
thread.title_full: Tony finds love after leaving The Bachelorette mansion

title: Tony finds love after leaving The Bachelorette mansion
text:
Tony finds love after leaving The Bachelorette mansion Seanna Cronin | 8th Oct 2015 6:00 AM Seanna Cronin APN Entertainment Editor A US ex-pat, Seanna has been writing about the Australian entertainment industries for the past six years and is also a documentary producer, photographer and scuba diver. The Bachelorette contestant Tony Strugar. Channel 10 Local Real Estate Subscribe Now 
TONY Strugar might not have found love with Bachelorette Sam Frost, but he does thank her and the show for leading him to his new lady love. 
The Brisbane-based airline cabin manager was one of two suitors (the other was Kayne Buik) Frost sent home last night. 
But 32-year-old Strugar has met his dream woman since leaving the reality dating show. 
"I wouldn't have met her if I hadn't gone on the show," he told APN. 
"I wasn't really putting myself out there before the show. I wasn't getting out there and trying to meet anyone. Tony Strugar pictured centre right with Sam Frost and other bachelors in a scene from The Bachelorette. Channel 10 
"Since the show I've been getting out, talking to people more and I met her that way. I went on the show to find love and I did. Even though I didn't win Sam, it worked out for the best." 
Strugar and his girlfriend even watch the show together. 
"She has a laugh with it just like I do," he said. 
"When I first told her I was on the show she was like 'What's that?' She's been living in Italy for the past five years and didn't know of The Bachelorette or The Bachelor. Now she loves it; she's into it more than I am." 
Before his elimination, Strugar was invited on a casino-themed double date with Frost and fellow bachelor Davey Lloyd. Tony Strugar, Sam Frost and Davey Lloyd pictured on a double date in Sydney Harbour on The Bachelorette. Channel 10 
Viewers branded it the show's most awkward moment so far. 
"You should expect it to be awkward when it's a double date and you're fighting for the same girl," Strugar said. 
"From my conversations with Sam in the house before the date I could tell I wasn't showing the fun side of me. I didn't want to just try to be a fun person; it has to come out naturally. Unfortunately we just didn't' have that connection and that chemistry." 
He tips construction manager Sasha Mielczarek and rope technician Richie Strahan as the show's current frontrunners. 
The Bachelorette airs Wednesdays and Thursdays at 7.30pm on Channel 10. channel 10
